meanings.definition: Something that discourages or deters someone from taking a particular action.
meanings.sent1: The high cost of the ticket was a disincentive for me to attend the concert.
meanings.sent2: Lack of job security can be a disincentive for employees to work hard.
meanings.sent3: The rainy weather acted as a disincentive for the picnic we had planned.
meanings.sent4: The strict dress code at the party was a disincentive for many guests.
meanings.sent5: The long commute to work every day served as a strong disincentive for him to take the job.

meanings.definition: A factor that reduces the motivation or desire to do something.
meanings.sent1: The constant criticism from his boss was a disincentive for him to excel at work.
meanings.sent2: Feeling unappreciated can act as a disincentive for volunteers to continue their service.
meanings.sent3: The lack of recognition was a disincentive for him to participate in the competition.
meanings.sent4: The negative feedback he received was a strong disincentive for him to pursue his passion.
meanings.sent5: The fear of failure can be a powerful disincentive for individuals to take risks.
